name: Creamy Shrimp Boil Pasta
description: Everyone’s favorite shrimp boil in pasta form with the most CREAMY garlic parmesan sauce seasoned with Old Bay, garlic and thyme!
recipeIngredient: 1  12.8-ounce package smoked andouille sausage, thinly sliced
1 cup vegetable broth (or more, as needed)
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper (to taste)
1 cup corn kernels (frozen, canned or roasted)

recipeInstructions.text: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta according to package instructions; drain well.
recipeInstructions.name: In a large pot of boiling salted water, cook pasta according to package instructions; drain well.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add sausage, and cook, stirring frequently, until sausage is lightly browned, about 3-4 minutes; set aside and drain excess fat.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add sausage, and cook, stirring frequently, until sausage is lightly browned, about 3-4 minutes; set aside and drain excess fat.

recipeInstructions.text: Season shrimp with 1 1/2 teaspoons Old Bay Seasoning. Add shrimp to the skillet, and cook, stirring occasionally, until pink, about 2-3 minutes; set aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Season shrimp with 1 1/2 teaspoons Old Bay Seasoning. Add shrimp to the skillet, and cook, stirring occasionally, until pink, about 2-3 minutes; set aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Melt butter in the skillet. Add garlic, and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute.
recipeInstructions.name: Melt butter in the skillet. Add garlic, and cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1-2 minutes. Whisk in flour until lightly browned, about 1 minute.

recipeInstructions.text: Gradually whisk in vegetable broth, heavy cream, Parmesan, thyme and remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons Old Bay Seasoning. Cook, whisking constantly, until slightly thickened, about 2-3 minutes. If the mixture is too thick, add more vegetable broth as needed; season with salt and pepper, to taste.
recipeInstructions.name: Gradually whisk in vegetable broth, heavy cream, Parmesan, thyme and remaining 1 1/2 teaspoons Old Bay Seasoning. Cook, whisking constantly, until slightly thickened, about 2-3 minutes. If the mixture is too thick, add more vegetable broth as needed; season with salt and pepper, to taste.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in pasta, sausage, shrimp and corn, and gently toss to combine.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in pasta, sausage, shrimp and corn, and gently toss to combine.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve immediately, garnished with chives, if desired.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve immediately, garnished with chives, if desired.

review.reviewBody: Damn Delicious indeed! I made this for the first time 2 weeks ago and it was SO good, I'm going to make it again when my parents are here Thanksgiving weekend. It did make a LOT and we had leftovers for days. While it says 4 servings, I think as the recipe is written, it could easily serve 6-8, especially if you serve it with a side salad or some yummy crusty bread. This time, I'll probably cut back on the pasta and sauce a bit so we don't have quite so much left over. Let's face it... refrigerator space is at a premium on Thanksgiving!!!

This was delicious!  We actually used our leftovers from a seafood boil last night.  I made the recipe as is but since our shrimp and sausage were already cooked just heated up shrimp for a minute using same amount of old bay and crisped up our already cooked sausage.  Simple and restaurant worthy!

This is going to be a fixture on our menu going forward - so good and super easy!  I love your recipes and I LOVE that Butters got to exercise his primal instinct of sheep herding ! 

Please keep cooking and blogging - you are my go to when looking at my fridge/freezer and wondering what to make.  ❤️
